thread.title: Federer thanks late Aussie coach after Open win | Tennis | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Federer thanks late Aussie coach after Open win | Tennis | Sporting News

author: Sporting News
title: Federer thanks late Aussie coach after Open win | Tennis | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 8:20pm EST January 31, 2017 8:03pm EST After claiming a remarkable fifth Australian Open, Roger Federer has been quick to acknowledge his late Australian tennis coach Peter Carter. Sporting News 
Published on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 31, 2017 
After claiming a remarkable fifth Australian Open, Roger Federer has been quick to acknowledge his late Australian tennis coach Peter Carter. 
MORE: Kyrgios' sly Davis Cup dig at Tomic | Federer has no intention of retiring 
Carter, who played professionally for ten years before moving into coaching, died a week before Federer's 21st birthday with the Swiss star admitting he wouldn't be the player he is today without Carter's guidance at such a young age. 
"Peter Carter had the biggest impact on me in terms of my technique. That's what so many people talk about," Federer told AAP . 
"When they talk about my effortless style and technique, I guess. I was able to perfect it later in my life, but he set the foundation and that's why I'm so happy that his parents were at the finals yesterday and saw me win. 
"That really meant a lot to me." 
Federer's memorable Australian Open win over long time rival Rafael Nadal has seen him rise to from 17th to 10th in the latest ATP World Rankings.
